question.text: Some people think remote work is better than office work, while others believe working in an office is more beneficial. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.

editor.placeholder:
Start writing your essay here. Refer to your plan in Section 4.

Remember:
• 4 paragraphs (Introduction, Body 1, Body 2, Conclusion)

guidancePanel.title: Writing Tips
tips: Follow your plan from Section 4 - don't change structure midway
Use topic sentences to start each body paragraph
Include linking words (However, Furthermore, For instance)
Avoid contractions (don't → do not, can't → cannot)
Leave 5 minutes at the end to check for errors

sections.title: Check Your Essay
sections.description: Use this checklist to review your work

items.label: Introduction clearly paraphrases the question (not copied)
tips: Use synonyms: work → employment, better → more beneficial

items.label: Body paragraph 1 has clear topic sentence about first view
tips: Topic sentence = first sentence stating main idea

items.label: Body paragraph 2 discusses the opposing view
tips: Use transition: However, On the other hand, Conversely

items.label: Conclusion summarizes both views + states opinion
tips: Don't introduce new ideas in conclusion

items.label: Both views are discussed with equal detail
tips: Count sentences - each view should have similar length

items.label: Personal opinion is clearly stated
tips: Use: In my view, I believe that, From my perspective

items.label: Specific examples are provided for each view
tips: Real examples are better than hypothetical ones

items.label: All parts of the question are fully addressed
No repeated words - synonyms used throughout
Topic vocabulary from Section 2 is used correctly
Complex sentences are used (not all simple sentences)
tips: Use: who, which, that, although, while, because

items.label: Verb tenses are consistent and correct

sections.title: Band 8 Model Answer
sections.description: Compare your essay with this high-band example

essay.fullEssay:
People have differing views about whether telecommuting or office-based work is more advantageous. While both arrangements have their merits, I believe that the ideal choice depends largely on the specific requirements of the job role.

On the one hand, working remotely offers significant benefits in terms of flexibility and work-life balance. Employees can structure their day according to their personal peak productivity hours rather than adhering to rigid office schedules. For instance, many software developers find they produce their best work during evening hours when interruptions are minimal. Furthermore, eliminating the daily commute can save substantial time and money, which workers can reinvest in personal development or family activities. This autonomy often leads to higher job satisfaction and reduced stress levels.

On the other hand, traditional office environments provide crucial advantages for collaborative work and team cohesion. Face-to-face interactions facilitate spontaneous problem-solving discussions and creative brainstorming sessions that are difficult to replicate virtually. Moreover, physical proximity to colleagues strengthens professional relationships and company culture, which remote settings often lack. For roles requiring frequent coordination, such as project management or client-facing positions, the immediacy of in-person communication can significantly enhance efficiency and team performance.

In conclusion, while remote work excels in providing flexibility and autonomy, office-based arrangements better support collaboration and organizational culture. The optimal working model ultimately depends on whether the position prioritizes independent focus or requires extensive team interaction and coordination.

strengths: Clear position with nuanced view (depends on job type)
Both views discussed equally with specific examples
Strong topic sentences in each paragraph
Wide range of vocabulary (telecommuting, autonomy, cohesion)

annotations.highlight: People have differing views about whether telecommuting...
annotations.explanation: Transforms the question language into academic style. 'Remote work' becomes 'telecommuting', 'office work' becomes 'office-based work'.

annotations.highlight: On the one hand... On the other hand...
annotations.explanation: Clear signposting helps the examiner see you're discussing both views systematically. This boosts Coherence & Cohesion score.

annotations.highlight: For instance, many software developers find...
annotations.explanation: Concrete, relevant example demonstrates real-world understanding. Better than vague generalizations.
Linking words show logical progression of ideas. Variety is key (don't repeat the same linker).
Academic vocabulary demonstrates Lexical Resource. Natural usage without forcing uncommon words.

annotations.highlight: which workers can reinvest in personal development
annotations.explanation: Complex sentence using 'which' adds sophistication. Shows grammatical range.
